alert.note: Alert for Miller; Pulaski (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 12 at 11:58PM CDT until July 13 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN MILLER AND WESTERN PULASKI COUNTIES... At 1158 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Iberia to near Waynesville to 7 miles west of Fort Leonard Wood, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Northern Fort Leonard Wood, Waynesville, St. Robert, Richland, Crocker, Laquey, Swedeborg and Ozark Springs. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 144 and 160. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
